subject: Re: [junit] Can I test web application using JUnit?
msgSnippet: Ive extensively tested our webapplication using JUnit and HttpUnit. With httpunit you can test the actual webservlet using a mock servlet container in order to
messageBody:
Ive extensively tested our webapplication using JUnit and HttpUnit. With httpunit
you can test the actual webservlet using a mock servlet container in order to catch
bugs while developing. Then with a little code adjustment I can test live-server with
almost the same testcases, so httpunit has worked out real good for us.

(BTW, we even use httpunit to contact some webservices in our application, so
it can be used outside the testing domain).,

http://httpunit.sf.net

//Erik

----- Original Message -----
From: Anagha Tongaonkar
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Saturday, September 20, 2003 10:30 PM
Subject: [junit] Can I test web application using JUnit?


Hello folks,

Can I test web application using JUnit?

What tools are available to test a web application
written using Java Servlets?

Pls let me know.
Thanks.
- Anagha.
